definition: variant of 稱|称[cheng1], to weigh
steelyard weight/stone roller/to polish jade with an emery wheel
although small, a steelyard weight may tip a hundred pounds (idiom)/apparently insignificant details can have a large impact/for want of a nail the battle was lost
pinyin: cheng4 tuo2 sui1 xiao3 ya1 qian1 jin1

sentences.english: I walked to the storeroom, hung the weight on the toilet chain .
sentences.chinese: 我走進堆房，把秤砣掛在水箱鏈條上。

sentences.english: Feel free to upset the equilibrium in order to have your needs met, especially in the bedroom, Libra.
sentences.chinese: 爲了滿足自己的需要，有必要顛簸一下你的秤砣。

sentences.english: The old standard weight had to be replaced because it was imprecise.
sentences.chinese: 舊的標準秤砣因爲不精確只能被替換掉了。

sentences.english: Becomes useful is ate steelyard Tuo iron heart.
sentences.chinese: 趙成材是吃了秤砣鐵了心了。

sentences.english: The value of men and women have unequal scales mound exists.
sentences.chinese: 男人與女人的價值，已經存在着不平等的秤砣。

definition: the tray or pan of a steelyard
the beam of a steelyard/a balance arm
steelyard weight/stone roller/to polish jade with an emery wheel
wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
variant of 稱|称[cheng1], to weigh
